title: DiRT 4

gpu: X.Org AMD Radeon (TM) R9 Fury Series (FIJI, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.9-1-MANJARO, LLVM 6.0.1)

title: DiRT 4

gpu: Intel Open Source Technology Center Mesa DRI Intel(R) HD Graphics 520 (Skylake GT2) x86/MMX/SSE2
notes:
By default the preset come as "Low" which makes the game run at 0,8 FPS. Shadows must be set to "Ultra Low" and Ground Cover must be set to "Off", then it runs at rates between 15 and 30 FPS, being playable at that framerates.

Some objects don't load textures and are completely black or white, but they can be seen.

Some types of vegetation are buggy and cover the screen as if they were huge, making the track disappear too but in some stages and DiRT Academy this issue doesn't happen, then being playable. 

Not a good experience in the current state.
title: DiRT 4

gpu: X.Org AMD Radeon (TM) R9 380 Series (TONGA, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.10-zen1-1-zen, LLVM 8.0.0)
notes: Cloud saves work, in-game networking doesn't. Works not a bit worse than on Windows, beside occasional shader compilation stutterring.
title: DiRT 4

gpu: Intel Open Source Technology Center Mesa DRI Intel(R) HD Graphics 630 (Kaby Lake GT2) x86/MMX/SSE2
notes: It worked perfectly with 40 FPS. However, it is important to mention that you have to use the correct NVIDIA drivers. I used AUR> nvidia-vulkan nvidia-vulkan-utils opencl-nvidia-vulkan lib32-nvidia-vulkan-utils lib32-opencl-nvidia-vulkan
title: DiRT 4
